items.content: The former president has been found guilty of trying to mount coup to cling to power after he lost the election.

items.title: Brazil's Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years after being convicted of coup attempt
items.standfirst: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, the far-right politician who governed Brazil between 2019 and 2022, was found guilty on five counts.
items.content: Former Brazilian President Jair Bolsonaro, the far-right politician who governed Brazil between 2019 and 2022, was found guilty on five counts.

items.title: Bolsonaro sentenced to 27 years for plotting military coup in Brazil
items.standfirst: Former president sought to ‘annihilate’ country’s democracy after losing 2022 electionExplainer: what did Bolsonaro’s trial reveal?​Brazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro ​has been sentenced to more than 27 years in prison for plotting a military coup​ and seeking to “annihilate” the South American country’s democracy.Justices Cármen Lúcia Antunes Rocha and Cristiano Zanin ruled on ​Thursday that Bolsonaro – a former paratrooper who was elected president in 2018 – was guilty of seeking to forcibly cling to power after losing the 2022 election, meaning four of the five judges involved in the trial had found Brazil’s former leader guilty. Continue reading...
items.content: Former president sought to ‘annihilate’ country’s democracy after losing 2022 electionExplainer: what did Bolsonaro’s trial reveal?​Brazil’s former far-right president Jair Bolsonaro ​has been sentenced to more than 27 years in prison for plotting a military coup​ and seeking to “annihilate” the South American country’s democracy.Justices Cármen Lúcia Antunes Rocha and Cristiano Zanin ruled on ​Thursday that Bolsonaro – a former paratrooper who was elected president in 2018 – was guilty of seeking to forcibly cling to power after losing the 2022 election, meaning four of the five judges involved in the trial had found Brazil’s former leader guilty. Continue reading...

items.title: What did Jair Bolsonaro’s trial reveal about an attempted coup in Brazil?
items.standfirst: Far-right ex-president was found to have led a ‘criminal organisation’ to try to stay in powerBolsonaro found guilty of plotting military coupBrazil’s supreme court has made Jair Bolsonaro the first former president in the country’s history to be convicted for attempting a coup.The 70-year-old far-right leader claims he is the victim of political persecution, but four out of five judges concluded on Thursday that it was sufficiently proven that Bolsonaro and his close allies attempted to overturn the 2022 election, which he lost to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...
items.content: Far-right ex-president was found to have led a ‘criminal organisation’ to try to stay in powerBolsonaro found guilty of plotting military coupBrazil’s supreme court has made Jair Bolsonaro the first former president in the country’s history to be convicted for attempting a coup.The 70-year-old far-right leader claims he is the victim of political persecution, but four out of five judges concluded on Thursday that it was sufficiently proven that Bolsonaro and his close allies attempted to overturn the 2022 election, which he lost to Luiz Inácio Lula da Silva. Continue reading...

items.title: Brazil's ex-president sentenced to 27 years in jail - as Trump warns conviction is 'very bad' for country
items.standfirst: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison for attempting a coup to stay in power after his 2022 election defeat.
items.content: Brazil's former president Jair Bolsonaro has been sentenced to 27 years and three months in prison for attempting a coup to stay in power after his 2022 election defeat.

ai_summary: Jair Bolsonaro was sentenced to over 27 years in prison for plotting a coup.
He was found guilty of attempting to cling to power after losing the election.
The former president sought to "annihilate" Brazil's democracy.
Four out of five judges found Bolsonaro guilty of attempting a coup.
Bolsonaro is the first former president in Brazil's history convicted of a coup.

items.standfirst: Elon Musk may be trying to pivot Tesla Inc. away from electric vehicles and toward humanoid robots, but to skeptical investors there’s no hiding from its stagnating sales and eye-watering stock market valuation that leaves little room for error.
items.content: Elon Musk may be trying to pivot Tesla Inc. away from electric vehicles and toward humanoid robots, but to skeptical investors there’s no hiding from its stagnating sales and eye-watering stock market valuation that leaves little room for error.

ai_summary: Tesla may be pivoting from electric vehicles to humanoid robots, according to reports.
Investors are questioning Tesla's sales figures and its high market valuation.
The stock market valuation leaves little room for error, investors believe.
Elon Musk is reportedly trying to shift the company's focus.
There is skepticism about the company's ability to succeed in this new direction.

clusters.title: Stephen Lawrence’s mother makes plea for witnesses as review begins
clusters.neutral_headline: Stephen Lawrence's mother appeals for witnesses in murder case

items.title: Stephen Lawrence’s mother makes plea for witnesses as review begins
items.standfirst: Doreen Lawrence says review of decision to close investigation into her son’s murder is ‘last opportunity’ for justiceThe mother of Stephen Lawrence has urged witnesses to come forward to assist a review into her son’s racist murder more than 30 years ago.A gang chased, surrounded and stabbed Stephen, who was 18, near a south-east London bus stop in April 1993; two men were convicted of his murder in 2012, but at least three members of the gang remain at large. Continue reading...

Continue reading...

items.title: Stephen Lawrence's mum appeals to witnesses as review into murder investigation begins
items.standfirst: Baroness Lawrence says review, triggered by BBC investigation, is the last opportunity for justice.
items.content: Baroness Lawrence says review, triggered by BBC investigation, is the last opportunity for justice.

ai_summary: Doreen Lawrence urges witnesses to come forward for her son's murder review.
The review is the last chance for justice in the racist murder case.
Stephen Lawrence was murdered near a London bus stop in April 1993.
Two men were convicted of the murder in 2012.
At least three gang members remain at large after the murder.

clusters.title: Venezuela says 11 killed in US boat strike were not gang members amid reports vessel was returning to shore
clusters.neutral_headline: Venezuela Says 11 Killed in US Boat Strike Were Not Gang Members

items.title: Venezuela says 11 killed in US boat strike were not gang members amid reports vessel was returning to shore
items.standfirst: Interior minister says ‘murder has been committed’ while US Congress demands justification for attackNone of the 11 people killed in a US military strike on a boat in the Caribbean last week were members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua, Venezuela’s interior minister has said, while US media reported the attack came after the vessel had turned around and was heading back to shore.The administration of Donald Trump has said the boat was transporting illegal narcotics, but has provided little further information about the incident, even amid demands from members of the US Congress for a justification for the action. Continue reading...
items.content: Interior minister says ‘murder has been committed’ while US Congress demands justification for attackNone of the 11 people killed in a US military strike on a boat in the Caribbean last week were members of Venezuelan gang Tren de Aragua, Venezuela’s interior minister has said, while US media reported the attack came after the vessel had turned around and was heading back to shore.The administration of Donald Trump has said the boat was transporting illegal narcotics, but has provided little further information about the incident, even amid demands from members of the US Congress for a justification for the action. Continue reading...

items.title: Alleged drug boat from Venezuela turning back when hit, sources say
items.standfirst: The U.S. military strike killed 11 people who the Trump administration said were Tren de Aragua members. A Venezuelan official denied they were involved in the gang.
items.content: The U.S. military strike killed 11 people who the Trump administration said were Tren de Aragua members. A Venezuelan official denied they were involved in the gang.

ai_summary: Venezuela claims the 11 killed in the US strike were not gang members.
The US military strike occurred on a boat in the Caribbean Sea.
US media reported the boat was returning to shore when attacked.
The Trump administration said the boat was transporting illegal narcotics.
US Congress members are demanding justification for the attack.

items.title: Trump assassination attempt suspect representing himself in trial, forfeits opening statement
items.standfirst: Opening statements began Thursday in the trial for a man accused of trying to assassinate President Trump last year in South Florida. Ryan Routh is representing himself in court. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.
items.content: Opening statements began Thursday in the trial for a man accused of trying to assassinate President Trump last year in South Florida. Ryan Routh is representing himself in court. CBS News legal reporter Katrina Kaufman has more.

ai_summary: Ryan Routh is representing himself in the trial for the alleged assassination attempt.
Routh was accused of trying to assassinate President Trump last year.

The judge reprimanded Routh for making a mockery of the court.
Routh forfeited his opening statement in the trial.

clusters.title: OpenAI and Microsoft sketch out deal to unlock for-profit restructuring
clusters.neutral_headline: OpenAI and Microsoft sign preliminary deal to revise partnership terms

items.title: OpenAI and Microsoft sketch out deal to unlock for-profit restructuring
items.standfirst: Nonbinding term marks progress in talks to enable ChatGPT maker’s eventual IPO
items.content: Nonbinding term marks progress in talks to enable ChatGPT maker’s eventual IPO

items.title: OpenAI and Microsoft sign preliminary deal to revise partnership terms
items.standfirst: Companies work to finalize terms as OpenAI pursues for-profit restructuring.
items.content: On Thursday, OpenAI and Microsoft announced they have signed a non-binding agreement to revise their partnership, marking the latest development in a relationship that has grown increasingly complex as both companies compete for customers in the AI market and seek new partnerships for growing infrastructure needs. "Microsoft and OpenAI have signed a non-binding memorandum of understanding (MOU) for the next phase of our partnership," the companies wrote in a joint statement. "We are actively working to finalize contractual terms in a definitive agreement. Together, we remain focused on delivering the best AI tools for everyone, grounded in our shared commitment to safety." The announcement comes as OpenAI seeks to restructure from a nonprofit to a for-profit entity, a transition that requires Microsoft's approval, as the company is OpenAI's largest investor with more than $13 billion committed since 2019.Read full article Comments

ai_summary: OpenAI and Microsoft signed a preliminary deal to revise partnership terms.
The deal is a step toward enabling OpenAI's for-profit restructuring.
Companies are working to finalize the terms of the agreement.
The deal could help OpenAI with its eventual IPO.
The agreement is nonbinding at this stage.

items.content: A mass prisoner release for sanctions relief.

The prisoner release was a condition for the sanctions relief.
The move was made to ease tensions with the US.

items.title: Ireland threatens to withdraw from Eurovision if Israel participates
items.standfirst: The Irish broadcaster said that Ireland's participation in the contest "would be unconscionable given the ongoing and appalling loss of lives in Gaza".
items.content: The Irish broadcaster said that Ireland's participation in the contest "would be unconscionable given the ongoing and appalling loss of lives in Gaza".

items.title: Ireland will not participate in Eurovision if Israel is allowed to take part
items.standfirst: Ireland will not participate in the Eurovision Song Contest next year if Israel is allowed to take part, RTE has announced.
items.content: Ireland will not participate in the Eurovision Song Contest next year if Israel is allowed to take part, RTE has announced.

ai_summary: Ireland will not participate in Eurovision if Israel is allowed to compete.
The Irish broadcaster announced the decision.
The decision is due to the ongoing loss of life in Gaza.
RTE said participation would be unconscionable.
Ireland is protesting Israel's participation in the contest.
